recode.net  (WEB - en-US)

A site owned by Vox Media publishing news, reviews, podcasts, and analyses on the technology industry.

This website generally maintains basic standards of credibility and transparency.
Does not repeatedly publish false content
Gathers and presents information responsibly
Regularly corrects or clarifies errors
Handles the difference between news and opinion responsibly
Avoids deceptive headlines
Website discloses ownership and financing
Clearly labels advertising
Reveals who's in charge, including any possible conflicts of interest
The site provides names of content creators, along with either contact or biographical information

Ownership and Financing

Vox Media, a privately owned digital media company, has owned Recode since May 2015. Vox purchased Recode from former Wall Street Journal reporters Kara Swisher and Walt Mossberg, who co-founded Recode in 2014 and had the controlling interest. Mossberg retired in June 2017, while Swisher remains executive editor. Recode generates revenue primarily through advertisements, sponsorships, and tickets to attend its event series, “Code,” which attracts top tech and media executives. Vox Media lists its primary investors, including Accel Partners, Comcast Ventures, Khosla Ventures, and others, on its corporate website.

Content

The site publishes news, reviews, and analyses on the technology industry, along with data charts and podcasts. It features original reporting, frequently breaking news on the tech sector. Interviews on Recode, especially by Swisher, often garner attention. In a July 2018 podcast, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg told her Facebook would not automatically remove denials the Holocaust took place. Amid widespread backlash, he sought to clarify the comments later by saying, “There’s one thing I want to clear up. I personally find Holocaust denial deeply offensive, and I absolutely didn’t intend to defend the intent of people who deny that.”

The site’s categories include Commerce, Finance and VC (venture capital), Future of Work, Media, Policy, Social, and Transportation. The site also publishes editorials in Voices. Recode hosts a series of events throughout the year, including the Code Conference, which examines the impact of technology on business and life.

Credibility

Recode is considered one of the preeminent sources for technological news. Swisher has been described by New York Magazine as “Silicon Valley’s most feared and well-liked journalist,” respected for her reporting. Articles are generally thoroughly reported and include links to both primary and secondary sources where relevant. Recode updates its articles with corrections when needed.

Transparency

Recode is transparent about its editorial staff. Each editor has a biography page, accompanied by an ethics statement disclosing any potential conflicts of interest. Editors provide email addresses and Twitter accounts in their biographies, and contact information for writers appears in stories alongside the name of the author. For other general inquiries, Recode offers a Contact page. Advertisements are clearly distinguishable from journalistic content.

History

Walt Mossberg and Kara Swisher founded Recode in January 2014 after leaving All Things Digital, the technological news and conference site run by Dow Jones, a subsidiary of News Corp, that was a part of The Wall Street Journal’s digital network.
